comment: It's math, it's hard, but Kohler made it better. For my class he gave us dates to retake things we did poorly on if  you came to class, he gives little quiz questions at the end of class but they aren't terribly hard. Overall, I would say take him 100% but show up to class and do your work. One of the best math teachers I've ever had.

He's the best professor I've had at KSU. All the tests and quizzes are taken online, except for the final. Each test and quiz has 2 tries so there's no reason for someone not to do well. He's a good professor, but he does have a strong German accent which may be hard for some to understand.
Great professor.  All tests and quizes are online and  you get 2 tries for each.  There is no way you cant get an A because of this.

He's a great professor. He's quirky, but it becomes endearing towards the end of the semester. Very clear in his expectations, and he'll give partial credit when you ask for it. Quiz/test questions come mostly from homework, so mastering the homework is important. There's always a quiz at the end of class, but it's never too hard. Highly recommend!

Professor Kohler is one of those that really just grow on you as the semester passes by. He's really a funny guy (weird sense of humor, though) and even though he can come off as a little harsh, he will truly try and help you. Make sure you always make it to class, if your grade is falling at the end of the semester he will definitely help you!

I enjoyed taking this class although Calculus is not my strongest skill. You basically earn your grade on MyMathLab. You can take quizzes and tests twice so there is no reason why you cannot get a passing grade. He gives pop quizzes so showing up to class is pretty mandatory. Funny guy with a strong accent and a great professor.

He has a strange sense of humor, very straightforward about what he expects from his students and uses MyMathLab for all homework, 3 tests and roughly half of the quizzes (the other half are pop quizzes in class). He uploads his notes but they are missing 90% of the info which means you need to show up to fill in the rest.
Great math professor. Attendance isn't mandatory but he gives pop quizzes and if you don't show up to class youll have a bad quiz grade.

Kohler is a great professor and makes Calc really easy to understand. He gives you two tries for every quiz and test. All the quizzes and tests are online except for the final. He also gives pop quizzes at the end of the class, so if you don't go to class you will get a bad quiz grade.

By FAR the WORSE professor i've ever had in my ENTIRE life... he will belittle you for asking a question or asking him to repeat ANYTHING!!! Be prepared to teach yourself EVERYTHING otherwise you will fail!

Easy class. Homework/Quizzes/Tests ALL online. Final in class. You have 2 attempts on all quizzes and tests, ?'s come from homework. You will be taking notes the entire class period. Very helpful if you have a question at the end of class. Like others said, he DOES have a dry, sarcastic sense of humor, but it is hard not to enjoy his class. Takehim

He is very helpful, clear in his notes, if you copy them, and he will answer questions, now if it was a dumb question he will make fun of the student, but if you get to know him, you know he is just messing with you not trying to hurt you. He is very understanding, and has a sense of humor. I would not recommend any teacher more highly.

I've found him helpful in general. He's trying to make sure the students understand the concepts. He will explain why one thing is and is not something. His sense of humor helps to lighten up the subject material.

Had Kohler for two semesters, loved every minute of it. His sense of humor is great! Ignore the comments about him making fun of you when you ask questions... usually it really was a stupid question, and he/she deserved to be made fun of. Definitely pay attention in class though.

Professor Kohler was a great teacher. The class wasn't easy but its set up so you will surely pass if you do the work and attend class as often as possible. The class consists of 4 tests, 1 final, multiple quizzes and homework. He takes your quiz average to replace your lowest test grade. Very helpful and funny. I would recommend him.
He makes math so easy if you just attend class and take notes every time. Do not use your phone in his class because he will call you out and embarrass you. Very funny also.

He is very fair.  Wants students to succeed.  Very funny.  I enjoyed his class even if I hate math, though I still got the top grade in the class.  Some reviews are unfair for him.  Math is not easy no matter who teaches it.  I'd recommend him for all math classes if I could.

This course  is harder than 1190! I wish I had known that when I signed up. If you have the choice between 1106 and 1190 then take 1190! Quizzes, homework, exams through my math lab (that saved me). Last exam and comprehensive final in class. We NEVER opened the text book. If you are a math person you may do well, if not then you will study daily.

He is an excellent teacher. Witty, friendly, and able to convey the material in a meaningful way. Students only felt stupid if they weren't listening and he had to repeat himself on basic concepts that should have been grasped much earlier on.

Great teacher. Fair, friendly, and seem to care about your education.Test questions are from homework and quizzes online.  Subject is not easy and but this professor is probably the best you can get at KSU.  Sarcastic and funny.  Nothing wrong there.

He's great at explaining the intuition of problems. I'll spend an hour trying to figure something out from the textbook, and he clears it up in 3 minutes of class time. In terms of teaching Math, he's one of the top teachers I've had. Sarcastic, sure, but it's always in a friendly/funny way and I've never heard anything offensive or hurtful.

Avoid if at all possible!!! I had no other options. Hard to understand, makes students feel stupid for asking questions, rushes through everything but still uses up the entire class time. I've never struggled in math until I took his class. If you are not great at math expect a C or below from him. I barely got an A but it was very hard.

Decent teacher on material, Horrific time in class. Guy still teaches in high school and will literal chew out adults for using phone in class. VERY rude,  and is not clear on material on tests. AVOID THIS TEACHER

I don't why people gave a bad comment, for me this professor is great! easy A if you done all the requirement. Little sarcastic, but no matter. He is great in explaining also, fast but if you pay attention and focus, you catch up. As long as you do all online the quiz and homework, which quiz you will have 2 attempt. I recommend!

After reading the comments on this professor, I am shocked that he was actually a really good teacher. Sure, he gets a little sarcastic if you ask a dumb question. But, if you pay attention he teaches you tricks on how to make calculus easier. He is helpful if you ask intelligent questions and genuinely need help. I recommend.

wow, what a terrible teacher! He teaches in a way that is inconsitent with the online testing system and will actually make fun of you if you ask a question. Would not recommend this teacher to anyone who wants to either learn or pass the class.

He comes off at first like a jerk. However, after 6 weeks you start to get his personality and it gets better. DON'T TEXT IN CLASS. It will incur his wrath, and he will call you out in front of the whole class. All and all I liked him.
Literally cried my way to a B...

This man really hates his job, people, and life in general. I got an A, however I had to use the math lab each week to learn the lessons because he was aggressive and angry all the time. I couldn't learn in his hostile classroom. Greatful I will never see him again. The math lab was excellent in helping study for test.

Good Professor..has his own easier way of working out Math problems, different from book's so, do not miss class.  Professor runs through class with several examples and only stops when it's time to leave. Does not allocate any time for questions and if you do ask, you probably regret it because he makes fun of the student!

Great professor!He's got a little bit of a dry sense of humor (but how funny can you be teaching calculus?). I had a terrible math professor the semester before, so I was pleasantly surprised that Professor Kohler does a great job at teaching the fundamentals of calculus.

He does have a very dry sense of humor and he will poke fun at you if you ask a stupid question (I asked a few), but he's a great teacher. You MUST know algebra in order to survive this class. I HATE math and I've never done well in the subject. He's the first math teacher that I've ever had that I've understood and done well! I highly recommend!!
This guy is a pretty terrible teacher. He doesnt like to answer the students questions and he can be hard to understand at times.

This guy is the worst teacher ever. He teachers about 3 problems a chapter, then sends you to work on MathXL by yourself. MathXL is more helpful than he is, by far! If you dare to ask questions, he will shoot you down without a doubt. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!

He is the worst math teacher I have ever had. Get the book - eventhough he says not to! He only works about 3 problems per section, then you are pretty much left to figure it out on your own. All of the work is on MathXL which actually teaches you more then Kohler does. If you dare to ask a question - he'll shoot you down for sure! He is terrible

Kohler was my 2nd attempt at making a C in 1106.  He was actually 10x better than the prior math prof.  Attend every class.  He makes you find study partners that live near you, use this!  Ask questions, he may embarass you a little but he will MAKE you understand.  If you take notes and ask questions you will do well in this class.  Nice guy!
don't take him. does not like to answer questions or give help.

is a horrible teacher. very hard to understand and is quite strange. Makes fun of students a lot and gives pops quizes. not funny. bad accent. makes fun of you when you ask for help. if phone rings 10 points of test grade each ring. get out now if struggle with math.

Fun teacher. He is fast paced so you need to keep up. Expects students to do the homework and practice the problems, essential in any math class.Very entertaining and is tough on students who do not follow simple rules, cell phones, late, miss a lot of classes, etc. I would recommend.

Poor teacher! He often criticizes if you ask a question and does not like people who need things repeated. He definitely has his favorites. Mathzone was more help to me than anything he taught. Go to class because pop quizes are a sure thing. He does not do good describing how grades are distributed and does not explain the class schedule well.

This was the hardest that I have ever worked for an A.  Listen close in class and take notes.  ASK QUESTIONS!!!  Ask questions even if you feel silly.  He will reward boldness(respectful), and hard work.  I attended every class.  Do not be afraid to speak up.  he loves it when you ask questions and are interested in learning.  Do the homework!!!
Not the easiest professor but his classes at times can be entertaining. He is Ok.

I have attended every class and I still will give this prof. a bad review. He teaches the material well if you are good in math and can follow at a fast pace. However, his attitude towards his student is just cruel.

Kohler has a sarcastic sense of humor during the beginning of the semester that just turns nasty as the semester wears on. He enjoys belittling his students and most are afraid to ask questions. If you do ask a question expect him to either A) not answer it or B) say this is something you should have already learned. He teaches at a very fast pace
Tough professor

Tough class, but very helpful professor; any bad reviews are probably a result of people who never went to class; he does not use the text book, but does use mathzone; homework is not graded but is very helpful as the test questions are very similar to the homework; definately take him!
Hard class for me but I am not that great at math in the first place. However he is a really good professor with a great sense of humor. Take notes and you will be fine.

Great professor!Don't let any of these bad reviews scare you.Quick to respond to emails,willing to answer questions in class.DO NOT leave your cell phone on-not even on vibrate-he will hear it,you will be sorry.Be vocal in class-he likes for you to participate-don't be afraid to talk.Lots of homework and studying,but you can make an A.
Talks like Arnold Schawsenager! Class is easy as long as you go and take notes. I didn't even buy a book for the class.
He was talking to himself all through the semester, I didn't receive any help with homework... Pretty-much I taught my self. Don't take him. 4 tests, +-4-6 quizzes, 1 final test.

He is an awesome teacher :) If you have a good sense of humor, then you will think he is hilarious. But if you are more on the sensitive side, then you may not enjoy some of his jokes. The class is a lot of fun as well as educational and you will learn a lot.  The tests aren't exactly easy but they are not too hard. Overall a great teacher!!!
Have a really good grasp on Algebra before attempting this class.  Kohler is a brilliant teacher and funny, but if you don't do the practice work outside of class forget it, you will sink fast.

Horrible teacher for this class. He might be a good teacher for other subjects but this class requires a lots of work and this teacher does not make it any easier.Try taking someone else for this class.

This teacher was AMAZING!!!I loved this teacher! Is clear about tests and quizzes (which are multiple choice)Towards the end of the semester he lets up a bit with the tests ie: tells how many A’s there are and B’s etc. DO THE STUDY GUIDES they are almost a replica of the test with different numbers used. Willing to help! Not a math person before.

The professor is nice and funny. I wouldn't recommend taking his class if math isn't your strong area or if you haven't taken math for a long time. The professor defiantly skips steps and expects you to remember them. Be sure to turn your cell phones off.

He seems like a really nice guy. He is funny at times. He isn't always the most helpful. He did give some extra credit. If it weren't for Math Zone I would probably be failing the class. As far as teaching, he is better than most math teachers I have had.

I read the reviews and took this class. Unfortunately, he is not that helpful. He is funny - true - but when asked to slow down to go over something again... he says "no." If you need more help in math, take another professor.

Not an easy subject but Kohler does an excellent job of explaining it and holding your attention. Keys to doing well in his class: Know your algebra, Show up, ask questions, and study. You can not do well in this course without practicing the calculus. If you can do these things then you will take away a great understanding of Calculus from him.

Great teacher! I was so scared to take clac! But he was awesome at explainging and he really wants the students to do well. The first few days may be scary I think he just tries to weed out the people who dont really want to be there. Show up, ask questions, and you will do well!

Is an excellent professor.  Makes Calculus easy.  Make sure you know your algebra and this class is relatively easy to follow with him.  It is Calculus after all.  Make sure you ask if you don't understand, He likes to put people on the spot that BS him... and shut off your cell phone...
This guy is awesome!  He makes calculus very easy and presents the material clearly.  He is very funny and loves to help students.  Take him for Calculus!

Prof Kohler is a great math teacher.  He lays out the material in a well organized manner and thouroughly explains all concepts.  Students that had trouble in this Calc class were students that had not taken algebra or other essentials needed to learn calculus.  This is not Prof Kohler fault but theirs

Mr. Kohler assumes alot about the students competency, knowledge, ability and recency of prior experience with math.  He moves through the material quickly and appears bothered by questions that take time away from his lecture.
he is great.  dont be fooled.  first few days are difficult but he explains everything, very clearly.
No Comments
No Comments
Bad German accent. Thinks you everything about math and belittles you when ask questions.
